channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The ‘Fed put’ is back: If Tuesday’s inflation report is bad expect chaos in the markets
item.description: Investors think the Fed will almost definitely cut interest rates in September, and they are hoping that the consumer price inflation report—due tomor...

item.title: Trump family crypto business announces $1.5 billion treasury company for World Liberty token
item.description: The announcement follows a week of reaching out to investors to contribute cash.

item.title: Data centers are eating the economy — and we’re not even using them

item.description: For Quebec City’s tiny English-speaking community, a former jail turned library serves as an essential sanctuary in a metropolis where the domination ...

item.title: Miguel Uribe, Colombian Senator Shot at Campaign Event, Dies at 39
item.description: Mr. Uribe, a presidential hopeful, was shot in June at a campaign rally in Bogotá in an attack that shocked the nation.

item.title: Tariffs on China Set to Rise Sharply Tuesday if No Deal Is Reached
item.description: President Trump has yet to formally sign off on an agreement to extend an economic cease-fire with China.

item.title: OpenAI’s open source pivot shows how U.S. tech is trying to catch up to China’s AI boom
item.description: DeepSeek's AI models are still influencing the AI conversation, even eight months later.

item.title: North Korea’s Next Leader?
item.description: Kim Jong-un’s daughter, Kim Ju-ae, is perhaps being primed to take control of the regime one day.

item.title: Trump Prepares to Meet Putin, and Al Jazeera Says Israel Killed Its Journalists in Gaza
How the CEO of a highly acquisitive company stays ahead of trends
item.description: How Julie Sweet positioned Accenture in the age of AI.

item.title: Clashing Visions of Syria’s Future Play Out in Ancient Alleys of Damascus
item.description: Many in the capital worry that the secular freedoms they enjoyed under the Assad regime are under threat from the new Islamist government.

item.title: Map: 6.1-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Turkey
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Hundreds of Indian Lawmakers Detained at a Protest Claiming Vote Rigging
item.description: Opposition figures were held briefly at a New Delhi demonstration after accusing Narendra Modi’s ruling party of manipulating elections.
